tagDescription: Acknowledging announcement of proroguing provincial legislature.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Enclosed: Grantham, 30 July 1811, requesting a land grant.
Requests land in Canada where he proposes to bring his family. Is on British half-pay.
Enclosing a certificate that Thomas B. Gough as commissioner for roads.
Informing him of the intention of many families to settle in Canada.
Same to the same. Crown reserve in township of Malahide moved.
Memo that John and Edward Ryckman are original nominees of Lot No. 13 in Sophiasburgh, certificate dated 24 September, 1785.
Report of Executive Council, 3 April 1811, relative to crown and clergy reserves.
Gives number of leases and land patents since his last report.
Report on his completed survey of road from Kempenfelt Bay to Lake Simcoe.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: informing him that Daniel Everitt has taken the oath as licenced surveyor.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Complaint of Robert Nichol against Samuel Street for unlawful imprisonment.
Enclosed: Certificates for Thomas Markland, Richard Hall, Samuel Street, Thomas Clark, and Gideon Tiffany as commissioners, 14 June 1811.
Attached: 14 August 1811, regarding the purchase of books for his office.
Capt. Evans of the 8th Regt. promoted to Major of Brigade.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Instructions to issue a fiat for commissioners for the purchase of hemp.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Certificate that new road commissioners, Richard Cartwright and John Cumming, have taken the oath.
Can find no papers in Council Office relative to Craig and others on the division line between Upper and Lower Canada.
Attached: Dec, 17, 1810, York. Regarding survey of the lands reserved for the Government buildings near the town of York. (copy).
Report on petition of Jabez Eaton's petition for Lot No. 24 in Bastard.
Requesting drafts of a letter from Gore to Lord Liverpool.
Instructing him to issue a fiat for a commission appointing Wm. Claus a member of Legislative Council.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Recommends Robert McLean as a surveyor.
Requests return of rigging used at the lighthouse.
Phin. Hubbard. Certificate for Silvester Cleaveland.
Enclosed: Expense account of William Firth for travelling.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Schedule of the Acts passed in the fourth session of the fifth provincial parliament of Upper Canada.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Commission for him to carry in to effect an act of the provincial parliament.
Applying for money to purchase hemp.
Directing a fiat be issued to prorogue parliament to 10 January, 1812.
Reports on three lots in the township of Thorold.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Report on a lot of land in Ancaster in favor of Eleanor Hanes.
Regarding the establishment of depots for small arms, etc., in U.C.

tagDescription: With requisition for stationery.
Notifying him Rev. Mr. Addison unable to attend to his duties on account of illness.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: On return of 1st. Regt. Lincoln Militia.
Informing, him that an issue of swords and belts has been sent to York. Authorizing 100 horse pistols being removed from Kingston
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Reports on Lot No. 171 in Township of Halowell, for Elijah Cuningham.

on subjects relating to the military.

tagDescription: Soliciting the situation of surrogate of the London district.
Enclosing an address praying for license of occupation for burial ground in York.

tagDescription: Annexed: March 24, 1812, Quebec. General Order. Commander of the Forces directs that the following circular letter of Nov. 8th be published in General Orders.

Report on lands reserved in East Framboro and Saltfleet.

tagDescription: Forwarding copy of the Acts of the last session of the provincial parliament. (Document not at this place.)

tagDescription: Report on Lot No. 28 in York. township of Wolford for David Durham Jones.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Apologizing for having opened a letter from Lord Liverpool by mistake.
Enclosing expense account for Mr. Firth.
Regarding an erroneous description of land for John Conklin at Ernestown.
Certifies that Solomon Jones, Peter Drummond, Thomas Fraser and Stephen Burritt have taken the oath as road commissioners.
Same to the same. Report on Lots Nos. 17 and 18 in township of Hope for Elizabeth Smith and Eliza Walton.
Notice of five locations in Binbrook becoming vacant unless the person to whom they were granted appear in 6 months to claim them.
Requests leave of absence.
Transmitting some U.E. Loyalist petitions for the Council. (Enclosures not at this place.)
Copy of a letter respecting lots Nos. 3 and 4 in Louth.
Enclosed: Letter 29 April, 1811.
Enclosed: 27 April, 1811, requesting £100 for survey made.
Petitioning that Rev. George Stewart, of York, be permitted to succeed his late father at Kingston.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Returning a despatch from Lord Liverpool of 15 Aug. 15 Aug. 1811, on the Law Officer's opinion regarding the Great Seal.
Asks resolution on Indian Reserve at Thurlow.
Certificate as to the character of Wm. Osborn.
Same to the same. Gives location of 200 acres for Lewis Bradley.
Respecting a Mr. McDowel marrying people contrary to law.
Gives a description of an island in the Rideau River, 15 miles from Ottawa.
Report on land for Timothy Thompson.
Enclosed: Memorial.
General Order. On recruiting for Glengarry Fencibles.

Reports survey of reserved lots near York is completed.
Enclosing his letter to Col. Shaw for land in Kingston.
Report on an application of Robert Gray of Etobicoke for land.

tagDescription: Report on the petition of Wm, G. Hepburn for locations.

tagDescription: Answer to the Inspector General's schedule of double deeds, dated 23 Nov. 1811.

tagDescription: Same to the same. Reports the examination of Shubael Park as a surveyor.
Informing him that Henry Markle is commissioner of roads.

Warrant for release of George Wyndecker.
Excusing an omission.

Notifying him that Hartman Freeland has given Jarvis power of attorney.
Relative to the Salt Springs.

Permission to repair Great Seal press.
Notifying him that the purchase of provisions has been authorized.

tagDescription: Report on the petition of Joseph Dorland for land in Ameliasburgh, with plan attached.

Attached: Sept. 28, 1811. Plan.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1810
tagDescription: Enclosure: York, Dec. 29, 1810. Memorial of Chewett & Ridout to Liverpool. Request half of salary and half of emoluments of Office of A.S.G. suspended, respectively, in the lands of the Colonial Agent and those of the Receiver-General, for the decision of the Secretary of State as to the appropriation thereof. Have performed duties of office from Jan. 6, 1807 to May 30, 1810.
Report on the petition of Stephen Jarvis for land in Ameliasburgh.
Report on petition of Robert Charles Wilkings.
Attached: Jan. 25, 1811, York. Order to give instructions for a survey to be made of the village of Gwillimbury and the Concessions in the Western Division of Etobicoke (Copy).

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Approval for purchases of Indian corn and a yoke of oxen.
Same as above.
Report on the non-performance of settlement duty by Messrs. Hall on lots in the village of Coote's Paradise.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Relative to John Pell Major request for land in Wainfleet.
Schedule of acts passed the 3rd session of the 5th Parliament of U.C.
Regarding the estate of York. Thomas Gummersal.

Regulations for ferries along River Niagara under Gov. Simcoe. (Signed by Major Edward Baker Littlehales.) Endorsed by Wm. Stanton. Since Simcoe's time rate of ferryage is regulated by Quarter Sessions.
Instructing him to furnish the Govt. printer with schedule of Acts.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Is unable to carry on duties of his office for lack of parchment.
Announces his arrival with some followers from the United States, intending to settle in Canada.
Enclosed: (1) Meeting of the Executive Council regarding petition of Wm. Claus, 14 Jan. 1812.
Same to the same. Report on Mary Gisso for land in Saltfleet.
Same to the same. Reports on location for Frederick Onstine at Rainham.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Announcing resignation of Lt.-Col. Pye as Deputy Quartermaster General; Capt. Gray to succeed.
Directing him to issue a fiat for proroguing parliament.
Regarding vacancy of doorkeeper for Legislature and Executive. Recommends Hugh Coffey and John Hunter
Transmits lease of Humber saw mills. (Lease not at this place.)
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Memo. Mr. Beikie given surveyor general's report (dated April) on Burwell's letter relative to Swayze's lands in Pelham.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Encls: Nov. 2, 1811, Amherstburg. Extract of a letter re. ordnance.
Solomon Hazelton and James McNabb, justices of the Peace, certify that Francis Dana is a resident of the district.
Return of 2nd. Regt. Leeds Militia.
Annual return of the militia of Upper Canada.
Intends leaving the government house at Credit in June 1812.
Same to the same. Reports on case of Abraham Beemer.
Remarks on return of the Stormont militia.
Enquires if Mr. Wilmot's survey is to be discharged.
Extract of a letter Relative to paying the Indian Dept.
Transmits letter from Col. Talbot and petitions from MacMillan and Fairchild of Westminster. (Enclosures not at this place.)
Appointing him to act as counsel for the crown, western circuit.
Transmits letter from Alex. McDonell with list of persons settled at the rapids of the River St. Clair.
Instructions for laying out a road from Kempenfelt Bay to Penetanguishine Harbour with townships at each end of the road.
Suggesting the expediency of a survey for U.E. loyalists in the Midland and Johnstown districts. Township of Reach has been surveyed.
Transmits return of 2nd. Regiment Lincoln Militia. (Return not at this place.)
Annexed: Mar. 2, 1812. Stating that since reporting to him an order for additional land was made out in the name of Jonathan Ferguson & reports thereon.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Enclosed: Petition of Jabez Eaton, 7 June 1811.
Replies to queries submitted relative to Upper Canada.

tagDescription: Explaining the need for registry books.
Regarding Mary Well's location for land on lot No. 23 in the 5th concession of Whitchurch.

tagDescription: Enclosing annual return of militia, 1st. Regt. Prince Edward.

tagPerson: Sheriff of the District of Johnstown
tagDescription: Remission of fine to Richard D. Fraser
Requesting an interview with the President.
Informing him that he (Brock) replaces Gore as administrator.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: General Order. Relating to the practice in the mode of issues to the staff & departments under previous general orders being found inconvenient.

Will inform the members of the meeting of the Parliament on 3 Feb., 1812.
Regarding Capt. Macdonell's mission to the Upper Province to ascertain the disposition of the Glengarry settlers to form a fencible corps.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: On the subject of the issue of provisions.
Return of 5th. Regt. Lincoln militia.
Encloses copy of a letter from John Cumming.
Enclosing proclamation proroguing the provincial parliament for the governor's signature.
Relating to deficiencies in gun equipment sent.

tagDescription: Relative to arrangements respecting Commissary McGill and Mr. Lane.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Transmits memorial. (Memorial not at this place.)
Report on Isaac DeMill's claim for lot no. 16 in Murray.
Enclosing a petition from land holders in township of Loughboro, Midland District, for a new survey.
Denies sale of lands by his son Moses Doan to Mr. Street.
Report on petition of Wm. Kent for land at Saltfleet. This land was refused Comte Joseph de Puissaye in order to keep open communication from York to Niagara.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Unfinished letter regarding lands.
Commission as Captain in the 1st Regt. of Prescott militia.

tagDescription: Annexed: Feb. 15, 1812, Quebec. General Order re First Lt. Chas. King.

tagDescription: Approving the removal of a detachment of the 41st. Regt. from Fort George to York.

tagDescription: Regarding the sailing of The Duke of Gloucester for York

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Regarding a refusal by Paymaster Raye, to sign provision returns.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: James Macklem, John Fanning and Benjamin Hardison renew a petition for a mill site below mouth of Welland River. Urge scarcity of flour as result of independence of company owning mills. State there are 20,000 bushels of wheat lying in these mills.
Authority for repairing the great seal of the province.
Enclosing correspondence regarding rent of Elmsley house occupied by the surveyor general's office.
Instructions by the Lt. Gov, that the allowance for office rent be included in his current half-yearly account, and that the said allowance be continued to be charged in the accounts of their office.
Enclosing letter from Col. Proctor representing the crowded state of the barracks at Fort George.
Acknowledges despatch transmitting his leave of absence from the Prince Regent.
Enclosed: Certificate, 5 June, 1811.
Jarvis to same. Advising him of clerical error in the Road Act.

tagDescription: Certificate that Elias Jones and Zacheus Burnham are commissioners of roads.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Regarding his complaint against S.Z. Watson.

tagDescription: Regulations regarding pay for working parties.

tagDescription: Giving information of person taking oak timber from the township of Seymour.

tagDescription: Requesting that the attorney general may be directed to defend his cause in the case of Nichol.

Petition for Lot No. 2 in Coote's Paradise.
Enquiring his pleasure for that corps on the King's birthday, 4th June next.

tagDescription: Will execute his commission under the alien act with strictness.

tagDescription: Warning him to keep on the defensive but not to make any aggressive move against the United States.

Authority to make sundry charges in Attorney General's account.

Directing him to issue a fiat for dissolving parliament.

tagDescription: Has prepared a proclamation for dissolving parliament.

tagDescription: On the resignation of Rev. Geo. O. Stuart as teacher.

Has forwarded Thomas Dickson's letter for a report by the committee.

Authorizing payment of 5/ for sweeping chimnies.

Regarding accoutrements, arms, and clothing for the militia.

Enclosing an Act passed respecting hawkers and pedlars.

tagDescription: Same to the same. Notifies him that a location has been set aside for Hon. Wm. Claus in Stamford.
Soliciting money to enable him to purchase hemp. His application of 9 Aug. 1810 has remained unanswered.

tagDescription: Authority to issue fiat for commissions appointing commissioners.
Asking leave of absence for one week to go to Niagara.
Advising him to issue his fiat for the several commissions for courts.
Regarding small piece of land in Cootes' Paradise applied for by Col. Claus.
Report on the petition of Daniel Tiers for the market reserve in York.
Enclosed: (2) James Stewart, Fort George, 24 July, 1811 application for leave.
Asking for land in Toronto.
Present state of military chest prevents his forwarding £5,000 sterling as requested.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Requesting information relative to his resignation.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: General orders for 23 and 24 April.

collector of customs. Authority to Wm. Allen to pay Joseph Kendrick £6.

tagDescription: Reports six patents for land engrossed.

tagDescription: Certificates belonging to Thaddeus Hamerly, a German.

Reports on survey of Gwillimbury. Requests information as to his surveying Kingston township.
Enclosed: (3) John Small, Council Office, 13 Sept. 1800, recommendation for Wallis Sunderlin to appropriate 2400 acres.
Enclosing certificate for Shubael Park from Thomas Dickson and Thomas Clark, justices of the Peace.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Acknowledges circular letter appointing commissioners for roads.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: On the subject of land communication with the lower province.
Enclosed: Plan of land.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Has received commission allowing him to act against seditious persons. Recommends his son as assistant surgeon in the Glengarry Fencibles.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Reports on boundary of Russell Square.
Encloses certificates of oaths taken by commissioners for roads.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Report on locations in favor of the Stewart family.
Desires to resign as judge in London district.
Regarding Anne Johnson's locations in Binbrook and Salt fleet.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Enclosed: (1) 9 Sept. 1806, regarding land granted Wm. Smith in Nelson.
Enclosed: (2) 8 Sept. 1806, grant to Wm. Smith.
Certificate for Jonas Abbot.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Acknowledging receipt of his commission under the Alien Act.
Soliciting patronage on his removal to Canada.
Directing a pardon be prepared for George Wyndecker capitally committed for steal a heifer, on condition of banishment for life.
The four books of Registry have been closed.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Transmits copy of the proceedings in Council. (Copy not at this place.)
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Has removed the name of Baldwin from sundry lots in Yarmouth.
Report that Lot No. 25, township of Trafalgar, is vacant and could be granted to David Morrison.
Enclosed: (1) Fort George, 25 July, 1811.
Informing him that 8 May is general day of fast, and justifying himself for previous letters.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Recommending Daniel Aitkin and Daniel Wallace for land in Canada.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Report on the petition of Frederick Starr Jarvis in Toronto.
Notifies him that Benjamin C. Beardsley's name is not on the books as notary public.
Applying for commission as magistrate in township of Markham.
Asking amount of salary to be allowed additional clerks in his office.
Same to the same. Has given Col. Talbot's brother William 1200 acres in Township of Malahide.
Transmits pardon for George Wyndecker for President's signature.
Advising him that the 100th Regt. will be relieved by the 41st in U.C.
Annexed: Undated General Order: Re. Military Chaplains.
Annexed: General Order: Major Maule's permission of the Commander of the Forces to proceed with a detachment of the 104th Regiment to join the Head Quarters of the Corps.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: U. C. Return of the 1st. Regt. Norfolk Militia.

tagDescription: Acknowledges 36 copies of Road Acts.

tagDescription: Enclosing account of ropes and blocks used in erecting lighthouse, belonging to Joseph Kendrick.
Report on the petition of John Scarlet for land on the Humber river.
Same to the same. Report on the petition of Elizabeth Solomons for land in Ameliasburg.
Enclosing petition from his son, Richard D. Fraser. (Petition not at this place.)
Respecting duties at the of St. Josephs.
Extract from letter 18 Sept. 1811.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Relative to establishing a garrison clerk at the posts of Amherstburg and Fort George.
Asks permission to resign his commissions on account of age.

tagDescription: Authority to pay Robert Stanton £100 as an extra clerk in the Surveyor General's office.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: On matters relating to the York militia.
Gives new names inserted in the commission of the Peace, Home District.
Report on land in Gainsboro from Wm. Servos, with plan.
Regarding a grant of land to Alex. McDonell and son.
Report on Big Otter Creek.
Schedule of acts passed in 3rd session of fifth Parliament.

tagDescription: Instructing him to issue a fiat for commissions.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Resigning his civil appointments to resume half-pay.
Directing an inquiry be made into the conduct of Lieut. Dewar at Amherstburg.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Relative to paymaster Raye's refusal to sign provision returns.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Acting Secretary. Requests his opinion on the case submitted by the magistrates in Quarter Sessions.
Announces arrival of Captain Derenzy with detachment of 41st. Regt.
Report on the claim of Abel Stevens and Jabez Eaton for land in Bastard township.
Enclosed: Haldimand, 28 May, 1811, regarding cutting of timber by transients.
Suggesting Stephen Jarvis act as deputy sergeant-at-arms.

tagPerson: Heward, S., clerk of the Peace, Home district
tagDescription: Requests that spike nails be furnished from the King's stores for repair of Home district gaol.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Report on the petition of John Ferguson of Ameliasburgh.
Report on the petition of James Schofield and others of an error in concession lines of Bastard.
Referring to mails.
Same to the same. Ten men are required for survey of township of Wainfleet. Encloses letter from Mahlon Burwell.
Report of the Board of Audit.
Requesting a commission as judge for Richard Cockrell, of Newcastle district.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Enclosing certificate of service for signature. (Document not at s place.)
Recommending George Wyndecker for conditional pardon.
Desiring fiat to be issued to announce Major General Isaac Brock's appointment as administrator.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Recommending Mr. Peters for some office in the new district at head of Lake Ontario.
Same to the same, Asks permission to issue a plan of lands at Stamford for William Dickson.
Instructions that a survey be made of lots nos. 17, 18 & 19 in the first concession of Pelham & that Mr. Lawe is to accompany the Deputy Surveyor.
Attached: Dec. 12, 1810, York. Order to survey the lands reserved for government buildings near York and lay out in 62 lots of 4 acres and seven tenths of an acre each (Extract).
Transmits memorial from the several justices of the peace for the appointment of a registrar of deeds.
Same to the same. Reports on petition of Peter Plumerfelt for land.
Same to the same. Report on a lot in Etobicoke for R. Gray.
Same to the same. Recommends Wilson Conger be appointed a surveyor.
Attached: (2) Schedule of deeds cancelled. Deeds dated from 1796-1799.
Same to the same. Transmits plan of Cadiz. (Plan not at this place.)
Has stayed the deed for Wm. Shaw in Trafalgar.
Schedule of patents engrossed in manuscripts conformable to the late Attorney General White's draft which did not contain the requisite reservations of crown and clergy reserves.
General orders. Appointments.

tagDescription: Regarding reports that Watson is charging fees for his permission to locate on road lots in Westminster.
On military matters.

tagDescription: Transmits papers relative to the petition of Hon, Richard Cartwright, administrator of the estate of Thomas Gummersal. (Papers not at this place.)

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Same to the same. Report on the petition of Wm. Bates for location at Trafalgar. In grant of 1806 from Mississagua Indians they reserved to themselves the water of Twelve Mile Creek, with the flats adjoining.
Certifies that John Strachan, Joseph Anderson, and David Cheek are road commissioners Eastern district.
Report on the petition of Duncan Cameron.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Same to the same. Transmits are turn of crown reserves in the London district, (Return not at this place).
Encloses copy of letter from Mahlon Burwell requesting £100 for the survey of Wainfleet.
Memo of articles issued for service of Gov't. House.
Appointment of James Young as road commissioner.
Same to the same. Report on the petition of Asa Townsend.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Reports on strip of land of about 2700 acres in township of Edwardsburgh.
Requesting authority to insert an expense item in his account.
Applies for land grant Woodhouse for Aaron Barber.
Acknowledges letter appointing him Road Commissioner.

Petition for land in Westmister.
